website_summaries.verdict: Similar to the Tide II but with a higher platform. Fit is slightly different from other Vionic sandals.
pros: Simple style with cute colors and patterns
Received the APMA Seal of Acceptance
Comes in a variety of colors
Soft woven toe post, foam-lined strap
cons: For the fit of the original Tide, order a wider width

customer_reviews.title: Feels good on my sore heel!
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis so I can't wear cheap flip flops. This is the only brand I've found that cradle and support my heel and high arch and they come in wide width! I wear 9 1/2 wide shoes and these 9 wide fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: I love vionic!
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of the Tide II flip flops so I decided to try the High Tide in the pink. And I love them too! With the higher platform, they feel a bit more cushiony- which I like! And they have the same great support for your feet! I decided to add a photo since there have been questions about what color the pink is. The pink High Tides are on the left. The right is Tide II in red.
customer_reviews.author: JoSam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Fits perfectly! I do have narrow feet, and ordered my usual size. They are very cushy. A little bit of a run at the toe so make sure you go a size up if you are at a half.
customer_reviews.author: Hhnursemom

customer_reviews.title: and it fit like a size 10
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 9, and it fit like a size 10. I went to Dillard's and found the same shoe, so I tried it on in a size 8. The smaller size did not work either, because the arch support (which is very good) hit my feet in the wrong place making them very uncomfortable. I suppose if this thong came in half sizes that my problem would be solved. While the quality was very good, I returned them due to the lack of fitting correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Elise D'Apuzzo

customer_reviews.title: Want to love, but I'm pain
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could love these. The fit is true to size. The heel and arch fabulous. The look is so pretty. But my toes are blistered. Sadly, I must return as they're just not working for me.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Vionics in Name ... Where's the Quality??
customer_reviews.text: I am a Vionics fan... well, I was a Vionics fan. I have multiple pairs of Vionics and love their fit... their style... and their customer support. However - these Vionics are a big disappointment. Fit - great. Style - nice (especially for flip-flops). BUT... I have had these sandals two months and the sides of the soles are completely shredded. And the footbed is coming up around the toe area. These flip-flops are far too expensive to look this bad in 2 months. I don't hike in them... I live in the city and work as a designer. I shop. These look like they've gone on hikes and were worn at the lake. Vionics.... what happened?
customer_reviews.author: Blue Waves Designs

customer_reviews.title: Killer Shoes and not in a good way.
customer_reviews.text: It was finally warm enough to wear these sandals and I am disappointedthat I bought them so early in the season. Not only did I pay too much, I didn’t get to “test drive” them until now. While the footbed is comfortable the straps are not. In fact the straps are not leather as described; they are rough plastic that have chafed the top and sides of my feet. To add injury the cost is now $10 cheaper, not that I would buy them again. These sandals do not live up to the vionic name or price and now it’s too late to return them. Not recommended. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Amaz(on)ing Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Narrow and the strap start to peel off.
customer_reviews.text: I received the item in a well packaged and on time with the prime. Unfortunately had to returned it. The strap was too small that rubbed on my skin. On the two side of the strap, the glue started to peel off that make the strap of the sandal may come off if I walked in it. At last, the brand name "VIONIC" somehow looked like a sticker and peeling right off from the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Levittowner

customer_reviews.title: Beware the slip-off!
customer_reviews.text: The straps on these were too long, so they didn't give the security needed on high soles - they allowed my foot to slip sideways. Within a few minutes I had a "slip off" to the side, and that can do serious damage to the side of one's foot if moving at a high rate of speed or over uneasy terrain. I sent them back. They were cute, though. Might be ok if the circumference of your feet is big.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hammel

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the style of the shoes. Not as comfortable as the flats though.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Great sandal
customer_reviews.text: I own at least 20 or more styles of the Vionic brand shoe. Some are great, some soso, and a few terrible. The sandals are by far their best product in my opinion. I really like this high tide style because it provides the arch support I must have and a great cushion heel cup. I will say that this style is more narrow than the flip flop version, tide, so if you are wider side will def. need to order accordingly. I will be ordering this style in multiple colors to enjoy this summer. The footbed of this sandal can get wet so that is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: dhdozier

customer_reviews.title: Cute style, toe strap very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are so cute and the footbed is so comfortable but sadly, the toe area strap made these almost torturous to wear on the first full day of running errands in them. My right foot was fine- my left, not so much- it rubbed my skin raw and left a sore. Also, the name label wore off on footbed within an hour of wearing. Disappointed. I'm returning these.
customer_reviews.author: NorthernLights1954

customer_reviews.title: I can wear these all day
customer_reviews.text: I wear from an 8 to a 9 — usually an 8.5 —depending on the shoe, and the 8 fits me perfectly. I have another pair in black, and I can wear both all day at work without experiencing any heel pain. If you have flat feet, you may have to get used to the higher arches in these shoes, but I’m so glad to have a sandal option that fits well and is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Elise McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Relief for Plantar Fasciitis at Last!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these shoes!! I started having issues with my right foot. Diagnosed with plantar fasciitis. I put these shoes on and have hardly taken them off since I got them two months ago! When I'm wearing them, my foot pain is greatly reduced. My only complaint is that they're kind of plain and I wish the thong part was a bit more attractive. But they're simple black so they go with jeans, shorts and skirts. I'm going to seek other shoes by Vionic.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Loose Strap
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and feel of these. Unfortunately, the strap is really loose which can be dangerous when your foot slides off the side or you slip out of them while walking. I've had that happen in other thongs with a loose strap. That risk far outweighs any benefit of the arch and other support in this shoe. I was really surprised at the loose strap given that my feet swell regularly, so normally straps tend to be tight rather than loose. I have ridiculously high arches and a tendency for Achilles tendinitis, so I was really hoping they would work well. I will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Expect More

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy! I'm glad I purchased these sandals. They provide the support you come to expect from vionic with the added bounce of the platform. It's a subtle change that feels like it's molding to your foot the longer you walk. I'm very happy with these sandals and would order again.
customer_reviews.author: Helene

customer_reviews.title: Most uncomfortable sandal ever!
customer_reviews.text: I had heard great things about Vionic so I was anxious to try this sandal. It was the most uncomfortable thing I have ever put on my feet! It felt like a brick with a hard bump in the arch and was actually painful to walk on. Most orthotic shoes I have tried have been supportive, yet cushy with a cut out for the heel and arch support. These went back immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Pupmom

customer_reviews.title: Very nice FlipFlop size 9 black
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful FlipFlop, casual and dressy. I purchased because it was a wide width. I did not have much hope it would be wide enough, but it was perfect. The arch support was good too. Normally I wear a 9 1/2 to 10 because my feet are very wide, however, the size 9 fit perfect. Sadly, I had to return these great shoes, because of my lower lumbar back pain. Just too much for me to walk in FlipFlops at this time. If anyone is looking for a Vionic Wide width FlipFlop that fits good heel to toe, this is the one. This one has a higher sole, but not too much , just right for casual or dressy.
customer_reviews.author: cambella

customer_reviews.title: Love them after fixing
customer_reviews.text: I have several pairs of Vionics. This style has a square piece above the thong that was rough and cut into my foot. I smoothed it off with an electric nail file, and they are now very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: BLS

customer_reviews.title: Love the arch support, but the straps give me blisters!
customer_reviews.text: Let me say that I generally LOVE Vionics...I have these, some "Roman" sandals, ballet flats and some cute white sneakers. I have plantar fasc and tendonitis and the arch support is amazing. Unfortunately, the straps on these keep giving me blisters on the sides of my feet! I have tried breaking them in...I really have. I have even lined the straps almost the whole way with moleskin. I am going to fully line them, and hope for the best.
customer_reviews.author: CJM

customer_reviews.title: very narrow
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed that these did not fit me. I normally wear a 7 1/2 W but can usually go to an 8 and they will work for me, my little toes go over the edge slightly but not enough to worry about, but in this style my toes went way over on both sides. I have 9 other pairs of vionic flipflops that this has worked for. Everything else about them is great, style ,color, support, and quality of vionic. Also the seller was great about having to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Susan smith

customer_reviews.title: What are you waiting for?
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I have a narrow foot and noticed my ankles were turning in when wearing other flip-flop type shoes. The arch support is great with these. No turning ankles in when wearing them. When I was at the chiropractor he noticed I had them on and commented they are great shoes. Said I’ll have less lower back problems when wearing them. Have noticed a difference already.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful shoe but too loose for upper support
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these due to the lack of upper support. Had I worn these out, my feet would have had too much lateral movement creating instability. Two other pairs I've purchased have a much wider upper. One has maintained its integrity, hasn't stretched , and the other has stretched but is still my go to since it's a perfect color for me. It does have adjustable straps - not enough adjustability since I've moved the buckle down to its last hole. I replaced the ones I sent back with with the Women's Pacific Rio Platform which I love. I now know I need the upper adjustability to maintain the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie H

customer_reviews.title: Feet are precious - do them a favor with these!
customer_reviews.text: Omg! Best sandals! As I've gotten older I've discovered wearing flip flops triggers plantar fasciitis and back problems and knee pain! Not with these babies! Someone at work told me about them. I bought them for a trip to FL and wore them and another pair of Vionics I bought the entire trip - no pain! In love!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only if you want the best shoes in the world.
customer_reviews.text: For me, these shoes are perfection. if you are in between sizes, go down- I am probably true 7.5 or 8, and the 7 fits... just barely, but I wouldn't go bigger. I do have narrow to medium feet, and these are perfect. I think there is a wide option that I would go with if that's an issue for you. The footbed is amazing if you have high arches or need arch support like I do. I have plantar and arch issues, and these are a dream. I wear them all day standing on my feet teaching. I own this shoe in 3 colors, and this one is so freaking beautiful. Love!
customer_reviews.author: Mea

customer_reviews.title: Received used shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these sandals and already have two pair. BUT - This third pair arrived and very obviously were used. The word Vionic on the food bed was worn off, there was dirt on the foot pad and in the grooves on the sole. The box included all the usual tissue and cardboard but they were on the bottom of the box, not around the shoe as usual. This is clearly not Amazon's usual service. I am very disappointed in this order. I will be returning them for a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Ok fit in the straps, not good for pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: I wear a pair of Vionic flip flops as house shoes because I have flat feet. The ones I'm wearing in our apartment are 2 years old and still work great. I ordered these for my baby shower but when I tried them on, the straps are tight across the top of my feet. My feet weren't swollen or anything and they weren't comfortable. I returned this pair in favor of the regular toepost sandals (same style, just the shorter heel) and they're still a little tight but it's easier to walk in them. The design is really nice; I stick with neutrals so this gold cork color is great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: The only flip flops I wear
customer_reviews.text: I have consistent issues with plantar fasciitis. And these sandals are the only ones I can wear that not only help while it heals, but it helps prevent future flare-up. I have another pair that I've worn for 3 years and they are getting worn out. And I wear them everyday. So I ordered this pair and they feel just like the other pair.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Not cute and noisemakers! Yes these shoes squeak!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as my age has shown me I was not kind to my feet when I was young. First: they are ugly. I expected more of a heel type look. They aren’t. Second: they squeak as you walk. I weigh more than I should, but my shoes shouldn’t creak, but I am not huge! It’s like they were crying from the pressure of my excess poundage. I returned them. I’ll try a different style of vionics as my girlfriends just rave about them!
customer_reviews.author: W. Marie Britt

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace a tired pair of Fit Flops but hesitating ordering another pair as I have found sizing disparities with Fit Flops, especially on different styles. I went on a search for a new brand / type of sandal - I am SO happy I did! I love my new Vionics - they were a perfect fit & I had no issues breaking them in. I slipped them on when they arrived & they are my new favorite casual go to for footwear. Well constructed - very pleased - will be adding different styles in near future.
customer_reviews.author: saba

customer_reviews.title: Terrific for realigning
customer_reviews.text: For years I had a bum knee I had to favor - some days good - some days bad. With the realignment the pain is virtually non-existant now. They are an expensive "flip-flop" but once broken in (as they suggest) you can wear all day long with great comfort. I now have 6 pairs of the sandals and two pair of closed in boots. I lost some weight so the size 9's I ordered in the sandals are a bit loose now. I have since ordered 3 more pairs of the sandals with the 1" heel in the 8 or 8.5 size(if available). Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mardi

customer_reviews.title: Strap is way to tight!
customer_reviews.text: These sandals would be awesome if the strap wasn't so TIGHT. I wanted to love these so much but after wearing them for 1 day I had bruises on the top of both feet from the strap. It has no give to it. I should give it 1 star but the cushion was so comfortable on my PF I gave it two. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: TawnyaA

customer_reviews.title: Life saving for my severe Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: My feet are wide, stubby, and I have Plantar Fasciitis on my right foot. These are the only sandals that provide immediate (seriously) relief to my very severe PF. When at home I wear them from the minute I get out of bed. While out and about (even in good support shoes and prescription orthotic inserts) I change to these as soon as I get home. Couldn't make it without them. Adding pics of my old ones and the newer ones. Also a comparison between a Wide and Regular (which I got on sale somewhere else and don't work that great for me).
customer_reviews.author: LunaAzul

customer_reviews.title: Strap came unglued within 1st hour of wearing.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. First hour I had them on the sandal strap separated from the soul. It was shipped in a plain box with no commercial wrapping. Probably were returned before I bought them. Surprised at low quality. Have bought this brand for years without problems.
customer_reviews.author: L. SCHMITZ

customer_reviews.title: Poor, and very poor for price
customer_reviews.text: I paid US$69.95 for this. Sizing is normal. I collected package on about April 10th or so, and wore regularly for maybe one month. The area where my heel rests has already started to sink on both sides. This is poor for the price of this slipper. Compared to Dr. Comforts Women Shannon Sandal (US$5.95) which i wore regulary like every day for a year before the same issue started happening. Wont be buying Vionic again, Will stick with my Dr. Comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Rena King

customer_reviews.title: Vionic quality
customer_reviews.text: Fit same as my other Vionic shoes The shiny top to these sandals means I can wear them as casual or to dinner so have to pack less shoes when I travel! They rub me where the top strap hits the top of my foot but that will stop after I wear them in Arch support feels good and I like the little added height they give me
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Strong arch support
customer_reviews.text: My podiatrist recommended this brand to correct my foot pain, and I'm still in the "break in" period recommended by the manufacturer. The Vionic shoe actually realigns the foot and takes a bit to get used to and to produce the intended results. But I can already feel a difference---less foot pain--and I think I am going to benefit from the very strong arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Tina C

customer_reviews.title: Not the same anymore
customer_reviews.text: Vionic has changed their footbed over the last few years. When they were first known as Orthoheel, the shoes were highly supportive. These shoes look like a higher Tide model, but they are narrower and less supportive. I put my Tide model against this one and the new one is definitely narrower....not by a lot, but enough that it was uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Coleen C. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: My extra-wide flat feet LOVE these flip-flops!!
customer_reviews.text: I wear an 11.5 x-wide women shoe! Add the fact that I have fallen arches/flat feet and finding cute shoes that didn't make me ache was close to impossible! Until I found the Vionic Pacific High Tide Toepost flip flops! In these fabulous shoes I wear an 11. I was experiencing knee and hip pain before buying these. But thanks to these and physical therapy I am feeling great!!! I love these so much that I've bought 5-pair of the same style in different colors!! I can't say enough positive things about these shoes! Best of luck! Sandy
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about buying this Vionic slipper without trying it on. I have used This brand for many years but never this style. What a wonderful surprise its been. It fits better than the ones Ive had. Lighter weight and more comfortable and just the right amount of support.
customer_reviews.author: Lori A Abe

customer_reviews.title: Favorite sandals!
customer_reviews.text: I only wear Vionics and these are (so far) my favorite style of sandals, I also have them in black and would like them in other colors! I wear Vionics for heel spurs and plantar faciitis, but would recommend them to anyone wanting better support for their feet. The first day I wore them I got complimented. while they aren't dressy, they are a step up from real casual sandals. They can be paired with a dress, jeans, shorts, maxi dress - whatever you want to wear them with.
customer_reviews.author: TJsGracieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Life saver sandals!!!
customer_reviews.text: These Vionic Orthoheel sandals are AMAZING. I suffer from very bad planters fasciitis and am in pain all day. I also have high arches that need good support. I have been in chronic pain for 5 years, and wearing these sandals around the house (I am a stay at home mommy) have been a real life saver. They are extremely comfortable. I am grateful for this company and these wonderful sandals. I highly recommend you try them. I just purchased the Vionic walking sneaker and look forward to their arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel B.

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love...poor fit
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these sandals. I tried them on in a size 9 in a retail store but they were too short so I ordered them from here in a 10 as they don’t come in half sizes. The one full size not only increased the length but the straps as well. They were way to big and flopping on my feet. I wish they came in half sizes. My podiatrist recommended Vionic shoes as I’m suffering from Morton’s neuroma in my right foot. The arch support was too much for my flat feet as well making them uncomfortable. Guess I’m back to square one!
customer_reviews.author: S. Ramon

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE FOR PLANTAR FASCITIS SUFFERERS
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is great, took a little bit to get used to. This helps me manage my plantar fasciitis, and prevents flair ups. I keep them on my feet around the house so I'm not running around bare foot. I used to not be able to walk, or cry at night from the pain. This coupled with a couple pairs of Brooks pureflow 6 tennis shoes has resolved most of my issues (as long as I don't start going barefoot) If you suffer from plantar fasciitis, you NEED these. Helps much more than stretching, and a lot faster.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: DANGER! I'm not sure these shoes should be sold to anyone.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are too expensive for being so big across the top of my foot. I haven't found a pair of vionic sandles that fit in a way that I don't feel like going to take a dangerous fall, but these went above and beyond. When I walked in them, my foot slipped around on the sole and the platform was so high that I'm 45 and was worried about falling and breaking a hip with these. Buyer beware, these are dangerous. I'm not even sure if they should be selling them.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna W

customer_reviews.title: Squishy!
customer_reviews.text: I love these flips! They're a tad narrow, but since they're flip flops a little overhang isn't a deal breaker. The soles are delightfully squishy but not overly so. Mmy feet and knees are a mess due to rheumatoid arthritis and the softness really helps take the pressure off my joints. Arch support is moderate, more than a regular flip flop I purchased 2 pair and love them both!
customer_reviews.author: AZMA

customer_reviews.title: Accurate information about product
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the worst sandal I have ever put on my foot! When they say “arch support”, they are NOT Kidd! Every shoe in the “Vionic” line is the same! The arch is soooo high, that you can’t get your foot in the shoe! I honestly can’t think of anyone this shoe might be “right for”, but I guess if you’re looking for a SUPER HIGH arch support, these are for you!! The shoe itself was very cute! Just the fit was bad!
customer_reviews.author: hellerlp

customer_reviews.title: Really Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I have only been wearing Fit Flops for many years because of foot problems and absolutely love them! When I saw these sandals and the reviews thought I would try a pair. As suggested, you need to wear them for a few days to get use to them and kind of break them in because at first the feel of them felt so different that what I was accustomed to. I really love the sandal and especially love the the platform heel. They feel good on my feet and the arch support is wonderful. I would definitely buy another pair with the same arch support and heel. Happy Customer!
customer_reviews.author: Loren Jones

customer_reviews.title: Runs a bit narrow
customer_reviews.text: I have 7 pairs of Vionic Sandals. I normally wear a 7.5M, but with this product you are supposed to size down, so I ordered a 7. After reading reviews I decided to order a wide and I am glad I did. This wide would not fit a truly wide foot. They fit me just fine. The length is good and the wide width fits like all my other Medium width Vionic flip flops. I really like having the extra height and find it adds additional heel cushion, which is great for plantar faciitis. If another color goes on sale at this price, I will order another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and have wore cheap flip flops for a long time. Finally I decided to buy better shoes! These Vionic sandals are very comfortable and do not make my feet and heels hurt. It does pay to buy better shoes! I live in Florida and the only shoes I want to wear are flip flops. So I'm happy to say that these Vionic's are my favorite flip flops! They are platform but not a problem to walk in. I love the arch support! The shoes are attractive. I would recommend these Vionic sandals especially if you suffer from plantar fasciitis. Buy good shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: May give a serious damage to your feet.
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are extremely uncomfortable. My feet hurt from the first day I wore them. I thought maybe as time goes by, it will get better. I have flat feet, so I bought these sandals, but the arch support is so uncomfortable. Now I have a huge pain on the bottom right side of my left foot, and it doesn’t go away. I have to see a doctor.. very disappointed. I wish I could return it... Would never ever recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: ArgZad

customer_reviews.title: Know your size
customer_reviews.text: As a routine wearer of Vionic, I know to go up a size in order to get the proper support for my arches. While this leaves a little extra in front and back of my sandals, the arch support falls in the correct location once my foot fully engages the toe hold. Unfortunately, this means I cannot wear Vionic shoes as the "correct" length shoes place the arch support in the wrong location. If you are new to Vionic, make sure you discover your size at a retail store before buying additional shoes online...
customer_reviews.author: Daughter

customer_reviews.title: Great flip flops!
customer_reviews.text: I had surgery on one of my big toes in 2018 and have to wear shoes that are stiff/unbendable in the front to protect my toe from bending. So far, this flip flop is the only one I’ve found that I can wear without discomfort. This brand/style is normally $65.99 so I jumped on buying these on Amazon when they were $40 something, and now I see they’re $30+. BTW - my feet are normal width but I need wide for these.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget girl

customer_reviews.title: the footbed is comfortable. If you wear a 9
customer_reviews.text: The scarring from the blisters on the top of my feet aside, the footbed is comfortable. If you wear a 9.5 in sandals, i would suggest the 9 as the 10 did not match with my arches. Don't walk too far in them for awhile. Unfortunately, I was at a music festival and walking from my car to the event was too far for the first wearing, and the subsequent walking DURING the festival just killed me...I don't know if I can ever wear them again.
customer_reviews.author: E. Scott Justus

customer_reviews.title: Vionics Are The Best
customer_reviews.text: After working many years on my feet, for most of the day, my arches and my body have taken their tole. Vionics are not only comfy to wear but also help my feet, my knees and my back from aching as much. I especially like the thongs that are high platform. The platform sole has more cushioning for comfort, as is the fabric toe post. This pair of Vionics is not my first and won't be my last.
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best sandal I've ever worn
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a little over a week and being as I live in Florida I've worn them every day. I got a tiny little blister from the toepost but that isn't enough to keep me from wearing them. I suffer from plantar fasciitis and regular shoes will ignite my pain after only a few minutes; I've been wearing a combination of Vionic shoes, including these sandals, for the last week and my feet/legs/back have felt better than they have in ages! Invest in these shoes!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Beth Marsala

customer_reviews.title: No more plantar fasciitis/ heal pain!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ive had painful plantar fascitis for months. These are the only shoes I wear now 24/7 with no pain! Im finally starting to HEEL! I've tried tons of shoes, orthotics, stretches, scraping, braces, socks, on and on!! The support in these feel uniquely further back then the numerous one's I've tried and the heel is deep so pressure is relieved. The high tide are particularly the best. The extra height adds support as I'm overweight. Their orthotics did not provide the same. After spending tons of $$$ on various things these worked out the best! True to size for me- size 8 and I have a slightly wide foot.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Poortman

customer_reviews.title: Confused
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the same pair from a retail shop last year that platform is slightly lower and the shoe bed itself is a bit wider-and they are supposedly the exact same size! Not sure what to do about these as I really like the style. I am going to contact the supplier and discuss...
customer_reviews.author: RVK

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the comfort of this orthotic flip flop sandal. Very, very comfortable for extended wear/use. Purchased to replace an old worn out pair of standard flip flop sandals that started leaving black coloring in my feet/heels, and after a pedicure, that wasn’t good. Had originally ordered my shoe size, but these sandals run long (no 1/2 sizes) so I contacted Vionic Customer Service and they confirmed to order a size down. Also, I’m trying the wide version; love it!. My feet aren’t totally flat, so I really like the arch support too. Definitely a thumbs up, I’m now seriously considering two other styles of Vionic shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: PAIN
customer_reviews.text: I invested in this shoe because I wear flip flops all summer and I wanted to give my aching nurse feet the support they deserve. The first few days of mild discomfort (I thought I could “break them in”) rapidly declined into outright pain in both feet. Arches, heels, the whole foot. I would have been better off walking barefoot. How can these shoes be so hard and uncomfortable? I couldn’t be any more disappointed. I’ll never wear them again. And I won’t even give them away because I don’t want to hurt anyone.
customer_reviews.author: di

customer_reviews.title: Not soft enough
customer_reviews.text: The sandal is too large and too hard on the bottom surface to work for someone with plantar fasciitis. Which is unfortunate since I need a sandal with good support. I have previously had better luck with Vionics fitting but they seem too large in general. I wear a size 5 and all the pairs I ordered were too loose - and I have high arches that usually require extra room. Otherwise they are really cute!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Z

customer_reviews.title: Great for people with RA/plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I am a 50-something woman with both rheumatoid and psoriatic arthritis, whose symptoms rear their heads in my feet. I have very wide, high feet that are hard to fit. These shoes are amazing! I wear them around the house and all weekend. Unfortunately, my job does not allow for flip flops, or I would wear them there too (in the deep south, so could wear them most of the year). Love them!
customer_reviews.author: cinji

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is exactly as it appears. It fits perfectly and feels great. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is my own fault. I didn't realize how bright an entire pink shoe would be so I don't wear it very often at all. I kind of feel like I have neon feet. Instead, I got the pink Mimi platform sandal on sale which is neutral colored with a pink upper and love it. That one is perfect for someone older like me whereas youngens might like this one. After all, it's also water resistant which is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Sammi Randall

customer_reviews.title: Nice flip flops
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine recommended these because she has so many issues with her feet and ankles. Lately, I have been experiencing issues with my feet and ankles too. These shoes feel so nice on my feet. I can walk in them all day without foot or ankle pain, with the exception of a blister near the straps on the tops of my feet, but I just have to wear a band-aid and it feels better. Other than that, I do like these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa B.

customer_reviews.title: color dye from shoe ruins everything
customer_reviews.text: I love the foot bed of the shoe, great arch support, and stylish. I ordered the gunmetal metallic and I love this color scheme! It goes with most of my wardrobe. The only downfall is that any time the shoe gets wet, the strap bleeds black color dye, terribly. It has stained my foot, the floor, etc. it’s on the sole of the shoe, as well, and will not come off. So disappointed. I love everything else about the shoe. Changing to Chaco.
customer_reviews.author: SCarolinian

customer_reviews.title: Not true Vionics.
customer_reviews.text: Description said soft heel bed..not there hard and clunky. They don’t feel like the other vionics that I own. They also have a slippery bottom that I haven’t experienced with my other ones.wish I’d have saved my money on this pair. They look cheap. I purchased the cork look that looks nothing like cork. Should have sent them back but I hate to return items.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Blair

customer_reviews.title: The straps across the top are so tight I can't wear them for long
customer_reviews.text: The flip flops are as cute as they can be and from a brand I have had good luck with in the past. The main part of the shoes (the soles) are well made and sturdy. Unfortunately, the straps that hold them onto your feet are so tight I can barely get them on and they are not comfortable to wear for long. I already wore them outside, so returning them doesn't seem right, but if they don't stretch a bit over time, they will turn out to be a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous user

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend these vionic sandals. It is my 2nd pair. The first pair lasted more than 2 yrs of wearing every single day and even in the winter in warm climate. I felt this was great. Took me a while to get used to the arch but wearing a little each day and It really gave me an arch where I had lost mine. Now they are the most comfortable shoe. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Hadessah

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I actually ordered these sandals in the black but somehow their webpage keeps shipping in tortoise. I called before they were sent and after several calls to Amazon they were sent in the tortoise anyway. Already having this color I don’t need the same. Very disappointed that no one can help with this problem. That being said, I do really like the Vionic high tides and very happy with the way they help my plantar fasciitis. They have alittle height and stay comfortable while walking all afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING for my feet, WELL worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I usually have to buy a size up for flip flops but these I could actually buy in my sneaker size. They have HIGH arch support which is what I was hoping for <3 The color is a beautiful muted pink and the shimmer on the straps makes them great for everyday wear or with a nice dress. I will be buying more colors in this model!
customer_reviews.author: DStevensSATX

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, I wear them all day
customer_reviews.text: I have several pairs of Vionic sandals. I actually started buying them when the name was "Orthaheel". Very comfortable, I wear them all day, walk my dog, and my feet never hurt. Well made, good arch support, and a variety of colors. I'm still wearing a pair that I bought 8 years ago. Very well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sheree Christenson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are so cute - just love the tortoise color. Fit is true to size. Support is great, and since there is a bit of a heel - looks a little dressier than tour average flip flop. Will look cute with capris or summer dress!
customer_reviews.author: Susan from Texas

customer_reviews.title: My first pair of Vionics
customer_reviews.text: I have a small foot and there is a little more room than I'd like where the straps cross the top of the feet but if you have a fuller foot then I'm sure they'd fit good and snug. The first few days they really hurt in the arch but after about day 3 of wearing them I adjusted fine they felt great and very natural. I'll start investing in more styles and colors.
customer_reviews.author: JOJOG

customer_reviews.title: These flip flops saved my life
customer_reviews.text: Vionics high tide flip flops saved my life! These are all I wear, I have a pair for inside, and one is every color practically for every day. I had severe plantar fasciitis and couldn’t walk in any shoe without pain. The height and cushion of these flip flops are the best for me with my foot problem. If I could wear them to work, I would! (I am an RN, so clearly I can’t haha)
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Happy Feet!
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually a 7.5 or 8, but bought these size 7 and they fit perfectly! They are the best ever! I walked 5-10 miles per day for 17 days in Europe and had very happy feet! If it weren't for these, I surely would have been in a lot of pain. It is difficult for me to find comfortable shoes since I have plantar fasciitis, but these were amazing! I have recommended them to several friends, who all ordered them on the spot with no regrets! Wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: J. LAVALLEY

customer_reviews.title: Works well for accessory navicular syndrome
customer_reviews.text: My wife has had a problem with an accessory navicular bone that has caused her pain with walking. We don't really want to do surgery currently, so we decided to try to get some shoes that would hopefully help with the pain and give it support. We are very happy with this product. It has definitely helped with the pain at the end of the day. So I would highly recommend these shoes if you have a problem like this to help with walking and have less swelling and pain.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable until.....
customer_reviews.text: I've had several pairs of High Tides, because I love the platform height & living in Florida, they are functional. The only problem is, once the toe post stretches out, and it WILL, they are horribly UNcomfortable and need to be thrown out. They have a pretty high price point to be so disposable, so consider this when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Cherip

customer_reviews.title: Go-To for Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I love these - I wear flip flops all summer but last year I began having problems with plantar fasciitis. This make a huge difference. If I haven't worn them for awhile and begin to have pain, I can wear them for a couple of hours and the pain is much better. These are cute and do not look orthopedic, which is super important to me.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit
customer_reviews.text: So loose that just a few steps resulted in a fall with broken bones in left foot....length somewhat accurate but straps were huge in comparison. Not at all what I expected...no stability whatsoever!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tight, restrictive, narrow
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping these would be a great option in comfort, but unfortunately it was just the opposite. Very hard and tight fitting. The space between the shoe base and straps is very narrow, not allowing a comfortable fit for the foot. My feet are considered to be normal, but slipping into them was very tight and restrictive.
customer_reviews.author: anewday

customer_reviews.title: Jury’s still out
customer_reviews.text: Not as comfortable as I had hoped and ordered wide width which I’ve never had an issue with in the past but these are tight. It was suggested to me to wear a few hours each day to get used to the correction so I’m trying that approach. In fairness it’s only day 2 and I am not returning them. Also the box they were in had the size sticker ripped off so not clear what actual size I received.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy K

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand all the "Great" reviews?
customer_reviews.text: Cushioned insole, really? It was rock hard and the straps provided no support or stability whatsoever. I knew my ankle would twist in these if I tried to walk even a few feet while wearing them, so I had to return them. Maybe the sandal varies with materials used for each pair? I bought the Cork color and they were very pretty, that is the only positive I can say.
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN ELIZABETH

customer_reviews.title: Great Sandals
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are wonderful. They support your feet well, have a good arch & lots of cushioning. I am surprised that Vionic makes a wedge type sandal; but they are really comfortable and the strap attaches further back so they don't make the "flip-flop" noise".
customer_reviews.author: Lorene Orr

customer_reviews.title: Arch does not seem the same as my other Vionic thong sandals
customer_reviews.text: Love Vionic's arch support. But these seem to have a little less arch support than their other Thing sandals which I have 10 (gulp) of. Also I wear a 9M in their thing sandals and this one seems a little short and tighter (narrower) that their others which are none to run wide. The short length can sorta make me feel a little off balance in them - knowing what I know now I would have ordered a half-size up. I certainly don't walk around really fast in these like I do my others.
customer_reviews.author: From NC

customer_reviews.title: I will never buy cheap flops again
customer_reviews.text: I wore prescription insoles in my tennis shoes, which I wear much less than flip flops (year round), and have a fairly high arch. I am on my feet on concrete constantly and would prefer to be barefoot at any time, but these will now be at each door and the Vionic house shoes at my bedside. I actually had to get used to the support and gradually increase my wear time, but when I'm without them, I miss them.
customer_reviews.author: Sunrise

customer_reviews.title: Arch support, "air conditioned,' and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Just perfect for my summer toes and feet. Vionic by Orthaheel is not your flimsy flip flop. This is my third pair and they are spectacular. They feel good and provide enough arch support for walking long distances. I love the slightly high wedge heel, too. The price was right and the shipment came a day earlier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: gmamom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I own a lot of Vionic shoes and by far these are the most uncomfortable shoes I own. They fit weird and hurt my feet. I will not purchase this style again.
customer_reviews.author: leeh

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit perfectly. I am normally a 5.5 or 6. Ordered a 6 in these. They feel like they are custom modeled to my feet. The fabric in between your big toe and second toe never rubs or feels uncomfortable like so many other flip flops do. This is my second pair. First pair lasted over two years with very high use.
customer_reviews.author: Mdp1116

customer_reviews.title: Love my Vionics💕💕💕
customer_reviews.text: Received as promised by Amazon. No damage good condition. After opening I noticed the shoebox lid was slightly damaged. After carefully examining my sandals Im Happy to report the sandals were in excellent condition. I own several Vionic shoes and was not dissatisfied at all!!! The strap between my toes were little tight but after wearing them they’re feeling better. I Ordered my normal size 8. They are thick soled but I knew that.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Leger

customer_reviews.title: Another "WIN" With Vionic
customer_reviews.text: These are the 4th pair of thong sandals; I also own 2 pair of shoes. THE VERY BEST!!! Certainly not the cheapest shoe on the market, but so very well worth the price. The styles, the sublime comfort, the color options - perfection!! And the best feature? This line of footwear lasts a l-o-n-g time...an "A+, 12 out of 10" value!!
customer_reviews.author: Ocean State Girl

customer_reviews.title: vionic/Orthaheel with bounce
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Hightides. I only wear Vionic Orthaheels. These have even better arches and a soft slight bounce that supports and relaxes my feet.
customer_reviews.author: ktteaches

customer_reviews.title: strap is not tight enough
customer_reviews.text: I didn't notice it at first, but after wearing them for a while I noticed I always have my left toes curling down b/c the strap isn't tight enough. In general, my right foot is larger so I guess that's why it fits a little better on the right side. I wish I had tried them around the house more b/f deciding to keep them. My podiatrist said to get the ones with an adjustable strap... I should have listened to her!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn D.

customer_reviews.title: Hurts!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these sandals based on some of the reviews. From a fit perspective, they're about half a size bigger than normal - I typically wear a 7.5, and a 7 in these fit well. Unfortunately, however, the strap dug into my foot after the first use, to the point where it broke the skin. I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Kapa L

customer_reviews.title: Love Vionic, but not this one
customer_reviews.text: The shoe does not provide any stability and my foot slipped several times. It would be easy to twist an ankle or fall wearing these sandals.
customer_reviews.author: Pat in CT

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but get a 'worn' look quickly
customer_reviews.text: Just like most other reviews I have to say they "wear and tear" easily. I've worn them twice and there is already wrinkles on the sides of the shoe. Aside from that, these shoes are AWESOME! if you have plantar fasciitis, these shoes are wonderful for it. Instant relief. And the are so cute! And others noted that the straps rubbed them the wrong way, I had no problem with that, very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Mhochoa

customer_reviews.title: Everyone's foot is different
customer_reviews.text: This Vionic shoe was difficult to fit correctly for my foot. I normally wear a 9.5 but purchased a 9 since they are only available in whole sizes and many reviews say to go down a size. I probably should have gone up because they are a little too short but fit well in width and across my foot. The arch is very supportive. The sole is firm and not cushy.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Cummins

customer_reviews.title: Straps too short
customer_reviews.text: Had to send these back. They're beautiful and sharp but the strap is soooooo tight. I see alot of complaints about the strap.....so Vionic..... fix the problem and make the strap longer!!! Take a hint! I'll buy a ton of these in all different designs if you do. I was just diagnosed with arthritis in the top of my feet from collapsed arches and I'm a flip flop queen soooooo PLEASE lengthen the straps!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Natchaz

customer_reviews.title: Size matters
customer_reviews.text: The arch support on this flip flop is great. However, they run really wide! I ordered my regular size and couldn't keep them on my feet they were so wide. So those got returned and I ordered a size down. They are still wider and I expected but I can keep them on my feet. If you have a wide foot, these will be great for you. If you have a regular width foot, or a narrow foot, they probably won't be what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: It's me

customer_reviews.title: Good Support
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 9.5, however the size wasn’t offered so I went with a 10. It’s a good thing that I went up a half size. The 10 fits like a 9.5 in length. The support is good, but the arch support is slightly misplaced for my feet. I’m still keeping them because these flip flops are far better than the standard.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes, and I love how supportive they are. I really wish they came in half sizes though; I bought an 8 and it’s just slightly too big. Not enough to make it unwearable, but I think it would just be an overall better fit were it a half size smaller. Even with that though, the support is fantastic, the color is great, and I think these will serve me better over the summer than any other flip flop I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.author: Reveree

product_meta.title: Vionic Women's, High Tide Platform Sandal
product_meta.description: Women's Vionic by Orthaheel, Pacific Hightide Sandal. All day support and comfort, in a cute thong sandal style. This stylish thong has a flexible EVA dual-density midsole that provides optimal support, helps absorb shock and reduces pressure on the feet, knees and ankles. Synthetic leather and fabric upper Thong sandal style for an easy on and off Subtle raised dot design on footbed for traction Podiatrist-designed, biomechanical orthotic footbed with deep heel cup for support Flexible EVA dual-density midsole provides optimal support, helps absorb shock and reduces pressure on the feet, knees and ankles Lightweight rubber outsole Platform and wedge heel for a little height. Heel Height of 2.00 inches
feature_bullets: Thong sandal style for an easy on and off
Subtle raised dot design on footbed for traction
Podiatrist-designed, biomechanical orthotic footbed with deep heel cup for support
Flexible EVA dual-density midsole provides optimal support, helps absorb shock and reduces pressure on the feet, knees and ankles
